hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Transition via BTC 20-day Breakout with Volume Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) and BTC price breaks above its 20-day simple moving average by >2% on volume exceeding its 20-day average by 50%, a transition to BULL regime occurs within 3 days with 70% probability, generating a mean return of +5% over the subsequent 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often precede directional moves. A high-volume breakout from the 20-day SMA suggests institutional accumulation and a shift in market structure. Cross-asset confirmation (ETH) reduces false signals. The UK regulatory clarity provides fundamental tailwinds for institutional adoption.
entry_conditions: BTC daily volume > 20-day average volume by 50%
ETH price confirms with >1% above its 20-day SMA

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price falls back below 20-day SMA

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 60% of signals result in regime transition to BULL within 3 days OR mean 5-day return < +3% after signal.
